Posts.Content: CynthiaMac wrote: Hello everyone, I was just diagnosed on 11/1/2012 and found this web site this morning. I really need some guidance. I am 65 and have had annual mammograms for many consecutive years so this thing can't be that bad.  The latest mammogram showed a tumor as did the subsequent altrasound.  The biopsy confirmed cancer but I have not been told what kind.  My primary doctor (not an oncologist)  did not give me any information at all, just that she wanted the surgery as soon as possible.  She will schedule and appointment with a surgeon on Monday.  Will the surgeon be able to define the cancer further for me? Not ready to stampede just yet. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Just Found Out CynthiaMac Moderators

Posts.Content: Nov 4, 2012 03:57PM CynthiaMac wrote: Thank you to all of you for your replies.  You all make me feel that I have stumbled into just the place I should be right now.  I filled out the questionaire for "My diagnosis" but I had to keep hitting the "I don't know button".  I will print out a copy of that to take to my surgical appointment to guide my questions.  It will be a great help.  It did not occur to me to get a copy of the biopsy report but that is an excellent suggestion.  I can bring it home and search this site for detailed explanations.  As I progess through this nightmare maze I will get all reports in writing.  And thank you for suggesting I take someone with me.  My husband is a fearless warrior.  He's the one who found this web-site.  And this web-site lead to you-all. Many, many thanks and I will write you after the surgical appointment. - Cynthia
Posts.Title: Just Found Out CynthiaMac Moderators
